document.title: Alberta French as a Second language Program of Study

87883E34847A4E528F05A9433DCFA586.description:
monitor and reflect, with guidance, on their
ability to access and share cultural
information (10 R 4.2c)

F0F9BB9682D24FB5B8722E2EEB9416FD.description:
identify and develop, with guidance, strategies
for compiling, presenting and sharing
information, including those strategies related
to the use of information and communication
technologies (10 R 4.2b)

DA0CA601223B421DB90C6819B1F7684C.description:
identify and develop, with guidance, strategies
used for locating, accessing and
comprehending information in French,
including those strategies related to the use of
information and communication technologies
(10 R 4.2a)

4ADA29DB681142C7BCA3460E47A5D896.description:
GENERAL STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT ACCESSING AND SHARING INFORMATION
Students will, orally or in written form, …

905D6B719C4644E7B0E66943ED3F6B19.description:
• identify, with guidance, aspects of popular
culture of the Francophone world that have
influenced other cultures (10 R 4.1f)

8D0CF3777E354981A37C50BE7C63FFF2.description:
• compare and contrast, in English, some
practices of everyday living in certain
Francophone regions of interest to students.
(10 R 4.1e)

2071C774C7534987BB4017014E00A475.description:
• identify, with guidance, Francophone or
French-speaking men and women who have
had an impact on an aspect of life in Alberta.
(10 R 4.1d)

4A25A60F013041138E81CD962C10F55B.description:
• identify and share, mostly in English, factual
knowledge of interest to them concerning
Francophones in Alberta (10 R 4.1c)

5820E260E3424CE2A3B2F1FFCC11944F.description:
• define, with guidance, what the term la
francophonie means (10 R 4.1b)

74C2171231D9448AB126AFA27A5805F1.description:
• identify, with guidance, where French is
spoken within Alberta and Canada
(10 R 4.1a)

C3DE7EC150A746B9A9C67D2F06227A85.description:
R 4 – CULTURAL KNOWLEDGE
Students will, orally or in written form, …

A3FDA21348D1402798405B7C8CC611B7.description:
demonstrate courtesy and respect when
interacting with others, while contributing and
collaborating in a social setting (10 R 3.5c)

7942FD2A155C4BA1AB1AF96F0CA15767.description:
identify and develop, with guidance, strategies
to acquire sociolinguistic knowledge
(10 R 3.5b)

D3FEB2FDD410497A82CC18FB5044142A.description:
dentify and develop, with guidance, strategies
to aid in the awareness and development of
interpersonal and intercultural skills
(10 R 3.5a)

F80B61FC47DA4C1E92E3720295801520.description:
GENERAL STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT SOCIOCULTURAL INTERACTIONS AND SOCIOLINGUISTIC AWARENESS
Students will, orally or in written form, …

97636F2CB47F448F8343ACE49A3D875E.description:
• identify, with guidance, differences in
conventions for punctuation, capitalization,
dates and abbreviations in familiar and highlystructured
situations (10 R 3.4b)

A7AD585F70C2403096FA5F736678A371.description:
• become aware of the fact that French
punctuation and capitalization conventions
differ from English (10 R 3.4a)

957EDD09B6BF43E2BCACDBAB495E86F3.description:
• distinguish, with guidance, between formal and
informal language related to familiar contexts
and language experiences
(10 R 3.2)

657CED953C03469C9788461986A02E1B.description:
• recognize social conventions used by
Francophone speakers when interacting with
others in familiar situations, e.g., conventions
related to punctuality, greetings, leave-takings,
social space, gestures (10 R 3.1)

6E3EA7C542D9455C843A319E651ADAF9.description:
R 3 – SOCIOCULTURAL INTERACTIONS AND SOCIOLINGUISTIC AWARENESS
Students will, orally or in written form, …

144D6D99C4ED422DAB58B07273FD2068.description:
 monitor and reflect on their language
development, with guidance (10 R 2.20)

97145D90DF024209AAED9D2FEB0AD48C.description:
 identify and develop, with guidance, strategies
to aid in the development of a repertoire of
language structures (10 R 2.19)

AFF2FE53BF434BF6BB323BD80EACD50C.description:
GENERAL STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT LANGUAGE LEARNING
Students will, orally or in written form, …

4BECF932D37948708A6F3327F304B285.description:
• apply knowledge of word order at the phrase
and simple or compound sentence level using
familiar vocabulary and commonly-used
sentence patterns in modelled, highlystructured
and guided situations (10 R 2.18b)

E87A075E71EC42C681E4BB4CEF18B446.description:
• understand the concept of word order at the
phrase and simple or compound sentence level
using familiar vocabulary and commonly-used
sentence patterns (10 R 2.18a)

2EF467E851D6465F87AD8AECE9E506B5.description:
• understand how intonation, stress and rhythm
are used in French to comprehend and express
messages (10 R 2.16)

C30EADAC4C7D4B6DA449CCD260044DAA.description:
• understand how intonation, stress and rhythm
are used in French to comprehend and express
messages (10 R 2.16)

B1DB23ED3C064A399C46774287BD17F8.description:
• understand and use common interaction
patterns for question/answer; offer/
acceptance; statement/agreement or
disagreement in familiar social situations
(10 R 2.15)

31E42AD9480A420E85E7511A26C2CEE6.description:
• recognize the variety of question patterns used,
including rising intonation, inversion, n’est-ce
pas?, Est-ce que… and the use of les
marqueurs interrogatifs (10 R 2.14c)

56615373DA3A48E586E291620A978E5D.description:
• recognize the difference between a statement
and a question (10 R 2.14b)

503FF3B34CF44DFE8B8C453B7B74ED04.description:
• recognize the difference between an
affirmative and a negative statement
(10 R 2.14a)

8DB22EF9E3EA46DB82A4E65B6E11311E.description:
• understand and use select adverbs of quantity,
e.g., assez, beaucoup, très, un paquet de, un
peu de, une boîte de in modelled, highlystructured
and guided situations (10 R 2.13e)

D955CB59289A41B69C4E31C14E573992.description:
• understand and use select adverbs of manner,
e.g., bien, fort, lentement in modelled, highlystructured
and guided situations (10 R 2.13d)

FE71F4273CB14A0592351E223511089B.description:
• understand and use select adverbs of time, e.g.,
avant, après, demain, aujourd’hui in modelled,
highly-structured and guided situations
(10 R 2.13c)

5694D2AB47154D3A8C473EC199616C48.description:
• understand that in French there are a variety of
adverbs and understand their usual placement
(10 R 2.13b)

327F11F657004B86A55AA286C22E02DD.description:
• understand and use select prepositions and
prepositional phrases of location, e.g., sur,
sous, dans, devant, derrière, à côté de…, à
gauche de…, à droite de…, au centre de… in
modelled, highly-structured and guided
situations (10 R 2.13a)

9301773B0CC747119B19A2D924033531.description: • use knowledge of gender, agreement and placement of adjectives in modelled, highlystructured and guided situations (10 R 2.12d)

AA8CBEED776E4C3B9589E3DEC630A46F.description: • understand gender and number agreement rules for adjectives, e.g., petit/e, grand/e, joli/e, beau/belle, cher/chère, bleu/bleus (10 R 2.12c)

01248D9F78984A549A3FEDC260013389.description: • understand the placement of commonly-used adjectives (10 R 2.12b)

E1BC474B00024A02A265435030B76FD2.description:
• understand the concept of agreement of
adjectives with the gender of nouns
(10 R 2.12a)

1ED9255F0D3D4FEFA3951B7DC0AA93A7.description:
• understand the formation and use of negative
expressions involving ne… pas, ne… jamais,
ne… rien in modelled, highly-structured and
guided situations in the present tense
(10 R 2.11a)

A9286012E5D34D9F8A2AA1AC545EF6F9.description:
• understand and use the verb expressions c’est
and il y a in modelled, highly-structured and
guided situations in the present tense
(10 R 2.10d)

EB023F29A21746A9A85C98A87666C365.description:
• understand and use the following verbal
locutionary expressions with avoir,
e.g., elle a… ans, j’ai besoin de…; and faire,
e.g., il fait beau, in modelled, highly-structured
and guided situations in the present tense
(10 R 2.10c)

34C2428B5A314D8DAFAC61898E8E0219.description:
• understand and use verbs with prepositional
phrases, e.g., jouer à…, jouer de…, faire de…
in modelled, highly-structured and guided
situations in the present tense (10 R 2.10b)

ACDC5703E74B4B18A7B3AF1492572B5E.description:
• understand and use the verbal expression je
suis en train de… + infinitive to express an
action in progression in modelled, highlystructured
and guided situations in the present
tense (10 R 2.10a)

B917B2E330D445279EE248187F16C177.description: • use the conditional expressions j’aimerais, je voudrais and pourrais-tu in modelled, highlystructured and guided situations (10 R 2.9b)

06A82418A809414C8A14DE67BDA22A78.description:
understand that the conditional can be used to
express a need or desire in a polite way
(10 R 2.9a)

7F057EABEAD74406AB79E797AD84070B.description:
• understand the use of expressions such as je te
suggère de, je vous recommande de +
infinitive and apply this knowledge in
modelled, highly-structured and guided
situations (10 R 2.8b)

C43A98807A59430D8A1DA1AFF32082B9.description:
• understand and use simple commands related
to classroom interactions (e.g., Lève-toi!
Asseyez-vous! Ouvrez vos cahiers! Prends ton
stylo!) and some shopping needs (e.g., Achète
cette blouse! Prends ce modèle!) in modelled,
highly-structured and guided situations
(10 R 2.8a)

5870A049CBDD4273891FDDD69DF4151C.description:
• understand and use the verbal expression Je
viens de + infinitive to express a recently
completed past action in modelled, highlystructured
and guided situations (10 R 2.7a)

13A6D9209F964A4E9FB4FEF7BE75AD45.description: • use knowledge of le futur proche in modelled, highly-structured and guided situations (10 R 2.6b)

39B03DC317AA445BBEC664B7D762C00E.description:
• understand the concept of aller + infinitive
(le futur proche) to express an action that is to
occur in the immediate future (10 R 2.6a)

96B509012DAD40DA8E52FF99D6F0F95A.description: • apply knowledge of conjugated auxiliary verbs + infinitive in the present tense in modelled, highly-structured and guided situations (10 R 2.5h)

9E47C81D902A480387B24F4C7B1B11FA.description:
• understand the concept of a conjugated
auxiliary verb (e.g., pouvoir, vouloir, devoir,
aller, aimer, préférer) + infinitive (10 R 2.5g)

7BE657AA2C2A4405B61FA8CD506A2857.description: • apply knowledge of conjugation patterns of irregular verbs in the present tense in modelled, highly-structured and guided situations (10 R 2.5f)

B4D8CDF3ADD749DC8F407CF86E7F2200.description:
• understand that there are irregular verbs in
French (10 R 2.5e)

339B855B07C249BF9683316B7BCBFCC8.description:
• apply knowledge of conjugation patterns in the
present tense with frequently-used regular
verbs in modelled, guided and highlystructured
situations (10 R 2.5d)

7886F20C46E747288718B0437D417F08.description:
• understand the concept of verb groupings and
the corresponding conjugation patterns of
regular verbs in the present tense (10 R 2.5c)

25B47E673FD7444AAD19A73EE2F19D65.description:
• understand the concept of conjugation patterns
in French (10 R 2.5b)

DE9672D005EF4EE9B46F03852A821725.description:
• understand the concept of subject and verb
agreement in French (10 R 2.5a)

D1731A83D7F241F0ACDEF9C6F3CB5701.description:
• ask questions in modelled, structured, guided
situations using knowledge of question
formations (10 R 2.4b)

1E545A2C7B814486906447D6AF31E3FD.description:
• understand the formulation of questions with
intonation, Est-ce que, inversion and les
marqueurs interrogatifs : Quel, Qui, Que,
Combien, Comment, Quand, Pourquoi, Où
(10 R 2.4a)

AC141CBFE1DD40789FC1EF1A33B098DF.description:
• use the possessive structure de in modelled,
highly-structured and guided situations
(10 R 2.3b)

6CDC3392135B4F2E84967823DE712FAE.description:
• understand that de is used to indicate
ownership (e.g., C’est le livre de Paul./ Ce
sont les travaux des élèves.) (10 R 2.3a)

F1A11B41B9414B6AB5A0B66E6BB7205B.description: • understand and use les pronoms personnels sujets : je, tu, il, elle, on, nous, vous, ils, elles in modelled, structured and guided situations (10 R 2.2c)

BBB161B0B85D4FEFA6194415CAA4A6EC.description: • understand that there are a variety of pronouns in French, i.e., pronoms personnels sujets, pronoms compléments indirects, pronoms compléments directs, pronoms relatifs (10 R 2.2b)

8D28479DDBD24B7E949D5851E202D6E4.description:
• understand the concept of pronoun
replacements in French (10 R 2.2a)

02C6FE7BEA1D4CB1925878496B3A029B.description: − déterminants contractés, i.e., the contractions of à and de + déterminant défini, i.e., au, à la, à l’ and aux / du, de la, de l’ and des (10 R 2.1h)

E1C7B31EBF3B46D6A373D1C33DC21F86.description: − déterminants partitifs, i.e., du, de la, de l’ and des (10 R 2.1g)

7C46FF7C764543F0B4C942066733BDC9.description: − déterminants exclamatifs, i.e., quel, quelle, quels, quelles (10 R 2.1f)

1D1787797F394EF7B3FF439378510B07.description: − déterminants possessifs, i.e., mon, ma, mes, ton, ta, tes, son, sa, ses, notre, nos, votre, vos, leur, leurs (10 R 2.1e)

466CBCFCCB29469BBB0A5C09F82684BC.description: − déterminants définis (le, la, l’, les) and indéfinis (un, une, des) (10 R 2.1d)

C6D6D2CE7B534C2DB5B4813D818A830B.description:
• understand the role of the following
determiners and use them in modelled, highlystructured
and guided situations:

8D5066AE1E794E40A56A74C650FB6A17.description: • understand the concept of agreement between gender of nouns and determiners (10 R 2.1c)

2D8C977C84A64F76AC067E8CA84AD446.description: • understand that there are a variety of determiners in French, i.e., déterminant défini, indéfini, possessif, exclamatif, partitif, contracté (10 R 2.1b)

F3FFB38ED23E4A24AD8337E7EAAF5A78.description:
• understand the concept of gender and number
in French (10 R 2.1a)

E4C023664D1F41D4A208FA1DB293DFEA.description:
R 2 – LANGUAGE STRUCTURES AND DISCOURSE DEVELOPMENT
Students will, orally or in written form, …

03617131D3EA4146ACBFC48CD33E25CC.description:
 monitor and reflect on their vocabulary
development, with guidance (10 R 1.6)

E3EBB6203EAF4A7AA907FC8B3642080B.description:
 identify and develop, with guidance, strategies
to aid in the development of vocabulary
(10 R 1.5)

602AAAEF6D504E48ADBF8328E64E9429.description:
STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT VOCABULARY DEVELOPMENT
Students will …

859E8869DBF04BB0B64A56F584C555B5.description:
• develop knowledge of sound–symbol
correspondences to spell familiar vocabulary
correctly (10 R 1.4)

5BB3E70CDA7E4F5AAB247857B6AF45B9.description: • understand the concept of liaison (10 R 1.3b)

795060ECF136490C9349B85C61D37711.description:
• pronounce familiar words correctly by
associating sounds and symbols (10 R 1.3a)

65EAC99F5420414DA26FE5B6D0D40719.description:
• recognize that French and English are in
constant evolution, particularly in regard to
words adopted from other languages
(10 R 1.2c)

31640F894E314723AD1D4624A54FED46.description:
• recognize that certain words or expressions
cannot be directly translated from French into
English and vice versa (10 R 1.2b)

59A18C0232FE49C78C45CEA31A0F8950.description:
• understand and identify similarities in French
and English words in terms of cognates and as
a means of developing vocabulary (10 R 1.2a)

4F74BA9FDEA8456386DF413A8078FBDF.description:
• understand and use taught French words,
phrases, expressions and interjections related
to familiar contexts and language experiences,
in modelled, structured and guided situations
(10 R 1.1)

8694C54FA70043CE8AD889BBAEE2CE94.description:
R 1 – VOCABULARY
Students will, orally or in written form …

A03BD2F7BA0C4314A89F569878EA5E56.description: reflect on their strengths and challenges as language learners, with guidance (10 A 9)

1A810627B9EF49E0BADC2C2BB2887ECC.description:
 monitor and reflect on their communicative
abilities, with guidance (10 A 8)


525E47FD182441F7A004C3F7AF576C73.description:
 identify and develop, with guidance, the use
of a variety of speaking and writing strategies
to support the expression of their messages in
French (10 A 7)

4C7D8BBBE9644D8695140C9B2670F487.description:
 identify and develop, with guidance, the use
of a variety of listening and reading
comprehension strategies to facilitate and
enhance understanding in French (10 A 6)

D214052606F2497B9C3C2C1B2C62B8C7.description:
• concrete messages using a limited range of
known vocabulary and taught language
structures for simple aesthetic or imaginative
purposes in relation to familiar topics (10 A 5)

CCE2E403E08A42EF838587114EDDB16D.description:
• simple, concrete messages using known
vocabulary and taught language structures,
expressed one at a time, to direct, influence
and manage their or another’s actions
(10 A 4)

79A3406447894E339A7334514E7DFAF7.description:
• simple, concrete messages using known
vocabulary and taught language structures in
order to seek, gather, process and impart very
basic information on familiar topics (10 A 3)

BDB1F7BA0C4F4179B6680FCFABBFF606.description:
• simple, concrete messages using known
vocabulary and taught language structures in
order to form, sustain and/or change
interpersonal relations (10 A 2)

853557704B47478DA0C29B2146905685.description:
• simple, concrete messages using known
vocabulary and taught language structures
related to personal needs, emotions and
perspectives, involving familiar topics
(10 A 1)

913124D4F8DA47A6B9417E7C812E21C1.description:
A – LANGUAGE SKILLS AND FUNCTIONS*
Students will receive, process and/or express in French in familiar contexts, orally or in written form, …

6585E66B0D92461EB157BC54784EC1A2.description: − naming paid or volunteer occupations of friends or family members (10 C 4.1)

C93A0C8950D9432AB588650215C84444.description:

B981899DE2C84364A7050058D5C4F524.description: − identifying and describing selected Francophone public figures; e.g., public officials, sport or entertainment celebrities (10 C 3.5)

D02009E8969346CC9550C4F99D27CD1A.description: − becoming informed about current weather conditions (10 C 3.3)

ABF5843C0B76427188015D04AFDFFFB4.description:

including

156D30A0555D46619CCE0852F2268A70.description: − others that meet their needs and interests (10 C 2.5)

A2C1F1D143B1414FB9CC894292362C36.description: − identifying areas of the school (10 C 2.4)

EB7CA3AC1D7849F2842280376908E5EF.description: − participating in routine classroom interactions (10 C 2.3)

03B97D3051B7435F9898DDA06AD91B4A.description: − expressing preferences and describing personal routines related to their course schedules (10 C 2.2)

13BBA5467625495AA80651BA126F94E2.description: − identifying classroom supplies and furnishings (10 C 2.1)

9450536D2DEF4D4EA2A420C07C2BFC5E.description:
• language experiences in the educational
context, including

A819B8ABBA774E6EAD955727A3E1028C.description: − others that meet their needs and interests (10 C 1.5)

EFD5D6784A6A42AE9D7FE4CDD09A8322.description: − identifying, introducing and describing their friends (10 C 1.4)

454C7FD71C0D4013A4CC1C5927342E67.description: − identifying, introducing and describing their family members (10 C 1.3)

A7F0F378F7954C1E8B4DE8E439231428.description:
• language experiences in the personal context,
including
